ticket.title: [Rails 3 RC2] Rails fails to load controller whose name consists of a single character.
ticket.original-body:
## Steps to reproduce ##
0. `rails new example` 0. `cd example` 0. `rails g controller H` 0. `rails g controller Hello` 0. Open Gemfile and add `gem 'yard'` 0. `rails c`
Loading development environment (Rails 3.0.0.rc2) irb(main):001:0> HelloController => HelloController irb(main):002:0> HController NameError: uninitialized constant HController from (irb):2
My yard version is 0.5.8 And Ruby - ruby 1.8.7 (2010-01-10 patchlevel 249) [x86_64-linux]

version.title: [Rails 3 RC2] Rails fails to load controller whose name consists of a single character.

version.body: This is yard bug. yard gem defines it's own extensions to String and other classes. Their implementation of underscore method doesn't handle situations when there are several capital letters one by one.
